00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextIntegerFunctions.pl - adds integer related functions C(n,r) and P(n,r).
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 This is a Parser context that adds integer related functions C(n,r)
00024 and P(n,r).  They can be used by the problem author and also by
00025 students if the answer checking is done by Parser.  The latter is
00026 the main purpose of this file.
00027 
00028 B<Note:> by default, webwork problems do not permit students to use
00029 C(n,r) and P(n,r) functions.  Problems which do permit this
00030 should alert the student in their text.
00031 
00032 =head1 USAGE
00033 
00034     Context("IntegerFunctions")
00035     
00036     $b = random(2, 5); $a = $b+random(0, 5);
00037     $c = C($a, $b);
00038     ANS(Compute("P($a, $b)")->cmp);
00039 
00040 B<Note:> If the context is set to something else, such as Numeric, it
00041 can be set back with Context("IntegerFunctions").
00042 
00043 =cut
00044 
00045 loadMacros('MathObjects.pl');
00046 
00047 sub _contextIntegerFunctions_init {context::IntegerFunctions2::Init()}; # don't reload this file
00048 
00049 package context::IntegerFunctions2;
00050 our @ISA = qw(Parser::Function::numeric2); # checks for 2 numeric inputs
00051 
00052 sub C {
00053   shift; my ($n,$r) = @_; my $C = 1;
00054   return (0) if($r>$n);
00055   $r = $n-$r if ($r > $n-$r); # find the smaller of the two
00056   for (1..$r) {$C = ($C*($n-$_+1))/$_}
00057   return $C
00058 }
00059 
00060 sub P {
00061   shift; my ($n,$r) = @_; my $P = 1;
00062   return (0) if($r>$n);
00063   for (1..$r) {$P *= ($n-$_+1)}
00064   return $P
00065 }
00066 
00067 sub Init {
00068   my $context = $main::context{IntegerFunctions} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Numeric");
00069   $context->{name} = "IntegerFunctions";
00070 
00071   $context->functions->add(
00072     C => {class => 'context::IntegerFunctions2'},
00073     P => {class => 'context::IntegerFunctions2'},
00074   );
00075 
00076   main::Context("IntegerFunctions");
00077 }
00078 
00079 1;
